intro: Urtica caffra, commonly known as the African stinging nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features heart-shaped leaves with a dense covering of fine, stinging hairs that cause a rash upon contact. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and has a fibrous root system. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland and grassland areas. Urtica caffra is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
